entry.title: Fwd: [BIP 15] Aliases
entry.summary: The context suggests an alternative approach to specifying Bitcoin URLs. Instead of explicitly specifying the provider, an IIBAN (International Bank Account Number) could be used to map to a Bitcoin address. However, the author expresses dislike for this idea as it requires a single authorized institution to perform the mapping. The author suggests relying on the IANA (Internet Assigned Numbers Authority) for such mappings due to their history and wise execution.
